// Module functions may have been 
defined earlier by hand.
The following revision refers to this bug:
is this something you're working on Rafael?

Is it a P1 to have 
this test disabled (eg, do we have other tests covering this API)?
Mads, can you make sense of the stack trace in comment 0?
Ivan, in isolation I can't make sense of the stack trace.

bind uses apply with 
arguments for which we have an optimization in V8, but without more information I have 
no idea if this is related to that.
(No comment was entered for this change.)

I don't think anyone else is going to pick this up if it's unassigned, so back to the 
author of the test.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
(No comment was entered for this change.)
(No comment was entered for this change.)
So is this a crash in the test or a JS exception?

If it's the latter, we should re-
enable as FLAKY_ and see if we can still repro.

If the former, please add the Crash 
label and see if you can repro locally.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
The following revision refers to this bug:
TTF: Mark ExtensionAPIClientTest.GetLastFocusedWindow as flaky instead of disabling it.
Just crashed the Vista Tests (dbg)(1) bot:

// 
|apiFunctions| is a hash of name -> object that stores the?

// is implemented by adding 
a "handleRequest" function to the object.?

#5# 0A015101: copying dashboard file gtest-results/unit_tests\results.json to 
\\chrome-web.jail.google.com\chrome-bot\www\gtest_results\chromium-dbg-vista-
tests\unit_tests
The following revision refers to this bug:

Bummer: Re-disabling ExtensionAPIClientTest.GetLastFocusedWindow again because
the JS exception causes the test to crash.
ExtensionAPIClientTest.GetCurrentWindow also started crashing with the same message.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
The following revision refers to this bug:
The following revision refers to this bug:
Disable ExtensionAPIClientTest.GetAllWindows as it flakily crashes.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
Issue 44086  has been merged into this issue.
This is happening on more test cases in that suite (see  issue 44086  ).

I think the 
whole suite is susceptible to this crash.

We might have to just disable the whole thing 
if we can't figure out the crasher.
